document.docAuthor: Santos, Ana Lucia Freitas Dos, Araujo, Paula Beatriz & Bond-Buckup, Georgina
document.masterDocTitle: New species and new reports of Hyalella (Crustacea, Amphipoda, Dogielinotidae) from Argentina

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species and new reports of Hyalella (Crustacea, Amphipoda, Dogielinotidae) from Argentina

bibRefCitation.author: Gonzalez, E. R. & Watling, L.
bibRefCitation.refString: Gonzalez, E. R. & Watling, L. (2001) Three new species of Hyalella from Chile (Crustacea: Amphipoda: Hyalellidae). Hydrobiologia, 464, 175 - 199.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined:
Argentina , Province of Jujuy , La Quiaca , Yavi Chico River , ( 22º05’53”S – 65º27’16” W ),
3,432 m
,
May 2001
, UFRGS 3244 ( 3 males , 7 females , 2 juveniles )
.
Province of Jujuy , reservoir near Escuela Agrotécnica in Humahuaca ( 23º11’50”S –65º20’25”),
2998 m
,
May 2001
, UFRGS 3245 ( 29 males , 11 females , 12 juveniles )
.
Province of Jujuy , Tilcara, lake north of Tilcara , near Rio Grande ( 23º33’50” S – 65º23’05” W ),
2,503 m
,
May 2001
, UFRGS 3246 ( 3 males , 6 females , 1 juveniles )
.
Province of Tucumán , streamlet tributary of Rio de Los Sojas on Route 307 in the direction of Tucumán with Tafi del Valle ( 26º56’27”S – 65º39’56” W ),
1,855 m
,
May 2001
, UFRGS 3247 ( 15 males , 15 females , 3 juveniles )
.

Remarks. This species is known from Chile , Peru , and Bolivia ( Gonzalez & Watling, 2001 ). The samples from northeastern Argentina constitute a new record in that country, and extend the distribution of this species ( Table 1 ).

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Reports of species of
Hyalella
from Argentina and Falkland Islands.

subSubSection.paragraph:
This collection significantly enlarged our knowledge of the species diversity of
Hyalella
, increasing by 28.5% the species of this genus known from Argentina . So, it is necessary more studies of the argentinean crustacean fauna.
